Key Match Events: Roston Chase top-scored with 52 from 42 balls
Heinrich Klaasen hit a six and three boundaries off Gudakesh Motie in an over that cost the West Indies 20 runs
Marco Jansen held his nerve to hammer Obed McCoy over long-on for six to take South Africa to 124 for seven with five balls to spare
Roston Chase got a wicket in each of his three overs as South Africa slid to 110 for seven after 15.2 overs
Kyle Mayers made 35 off 34 balls as he shared in an 81-run partnership with Chase
Andre Russell got a double strike of Quinton de Kock (12) and Reeza Hendricks (golden duck) in the second over
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies finish the group third on two points and will have to wait for another occasion to try and lift a third T20 World Cup title
The Proteas top group II of the Super Eight phase with a perfect six points and keep their unbeaten run in the tourney alive
Miscellaneous Highlights: An hour-long rain delay added to the suspense, as the Proteas' target was reduced to 123 in 17 overs via the DLS method
Seamer Obed McCoy, who conceded nine runs in his first over, was entrusted to bowl the last over by skipper Rovman Powell

West Indies were knocked out from the International Cricket Council (ICC) Twenty/20 World Cup at 1 am on June 24 after falling to an agonising three-wicket loss to South Africa in a rain-affected game
